newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech PX50 closes lower in stagnant market.
newsitem.headline: Czech PX50 closes lower in stagnant market.

text.p: The Czech PX50 moved in familiar fashion on Thursday with major issues pulling the index slightly lower and activity remaining low.
The PX50 dropped 3.9 points, 0.67 percent, to 574.6 and the RPIX index of continuouisly traded shares fell 13.3 points, 1.09 percent, to 1,202.8.
In the broader market, shares in the Czech Republic's largest construction company IPS Praha defied the predictions of many analysts and posted a one crown gain to 276.
Many analysts changed thier recommendations on IPS to a sell after the company reported preliminary 1996 net profits of 91 million crowns - a 45 percent drop compared with the previous year.
A report by ABN AMRO Hoare Govett said the figures were particularly worrying because managemnt had predicted a rise in 1996 profits as late as last November.
"They (the results) are at odds with management forecasts released on 14 November 1996 predicting that net profit would increase to CZK 182 million," the report said.
